alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:53PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT FOR HUNTERDON AND SOUTHWESTERN SOMERSET COUNTIES... At 351 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lebanon, or 13 miles west of Somerville, moving southeast at 35 mph. Nickel size hail was reported in parts of Hunterdon County. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Somerville, Bridgewater, Bound Brook, Manville, Flemington, High Bridge, Clinton, Glen Gardner, Hampton, Lebanon, Califon, Flagtown, Sergeantsville, Cloverhill, Annandale, White House Station, Sand Brook, Raritan and South Bound Brook. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 8 and 28. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 12 and 19. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
